post.author: gavavva
post.body:
You don't seem to understand what I'm getting at...

First of all, it makes no difference you can make maps for Quake with QuArK, because Quarks an old, old old terrible editor for the old Quake with (last time I checked) VERY limited support for Quake 4... In other words, it will likely map with everything off, that includes shadows, the biggest killer of frame rate in the editor. So, you will be mapping with very old standards and everything disabled.

You can run Quake 4 just about if you drop everything down... But like I said, Q4Rad is different to Q4. Just because you can run one doesnt mean the other will be fine. Q4Rad doesn't display portals/hints etc, which means it renders the whole thing in one go. It will be even worse when you use real time preview.

Its your card man, simple as that. Its far too old to be keeping up to speed these days, and there isn't much to do about it.
